of The X Factor in 2007. Discussing his boss with New! magazine, Dermot O'Leary praised Simon Cowell for having time for everyone.`` Simon Cowell is a remarkably surprising, down-to-earth man,'' he said. You don't get that level of success if you haven't got a touch of normality.`` He's very much a common man, someone you could go for a beer with and who you'd have no hesitation in talking to about anything at all. I clicked with him immediately. He is a really nice guy, not affected, and has time for everyone. He's a showman but his head's not in the clouds. He is not aloof. Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
